reviews.review: Great game.
Pretty good Half-Life expansion. Honestly, it's only better than Blue Shift because of the weapons and enemies.

no idea how this one got so messed up compared to everything else. there are like, fifty weapons and most of them do the same thing. it could have been condensed down to half, but instead i have to sift through all these different guns when i start a fight. and the ending is so unbelievably weak, that boss fight was just pathetic. easily the weakest half life game by a long shot.

Ok. I don't wanna play games of this age unless they really excel in every regard (beside tech). While this game features interesting enemies, weapons and some mechanics tied to them, it's brought down time and time again by pretty awful level and mission design and weirdly unengaging combat. You will get lost, stuck... and always for all the wrong reasons.
Probably one of the best dlc's for a game i've played in a while.

Would be five star - except

How has the end game bug not been fixed on two platforms.  I believe both Mac and Linux have the system issue.

You CANNOT complete the game without enabling Console and typing "map of7a0".

By default you deal with the final alien, and the portal appears but you can't go anywhere......

I would still 100% recommend however, I can't believe this one liner hasn't been incorporated into the game files all these years after.

[h1] Half-Life: Opposing Force [/h1]

Half-Life: Opposing Force é uma expansão de Half-Life. O jogador assume o controle do Cabo Adrian Shephard, do Corpo de Fuzileiros Navais dos Estados Unidos da América. O jogador conta com um verdadeiro arsenal de armas dos mais variados tipos, chegando a atingir o dobro das armas de Half-Life 1. 

[h1] Enredo [/h1] 

[spoiler] Em Oppossing Force o jogador assume o controle do soldado da HECU Adrian Shepard. Quando a unidade de Adrian estava se aproximando de Black Mesa, foram atacados por alienígenas, assim, o helicóptero cai.

A missão de Adrian, como os outros Fuzileiros, é chegar a Black Mesa e eliminar as provas do acidente. Porém, Adrian nunca teve essa intenção. Acontece que, quando Adrian ia no helicóptero, os Xenianos (os extaterrestres de Half-Life 1) o atacam, fazendo com que Adrian tenha de lutar pela sua vida. Então ele é salvo pelos cientistas e recebe ordens de eliminar Gordon Freeman (por isso ele segue Freeman até o portal).

Em Black Mesa, Adrian vê o caos em que Black Mesa havia se tornado, cientistas e seguranças mortos e alienígenas andando pelo complexo. Assim Adrian precisa lutar para escapar. Perto do final do jogo, o jogador tem a opção de seguir Gordon no portal para Xen. Mas acaba indo para uma outra área do planeta onde tem uma conversa com G-man e acaba suspenso no tempo. [/spoiler]
I swear if he's not in Half Life 3
the coolest half life expansion, adds so many enemies and weapons. you even get to play as the hecu. one of my favorite parts of the game is boot camp, which takes the place of the training room.

Half-Life Opposing Force is an amazing addition to Half-Life. The new weapons, enemies, and utilities are extremely good. Although there are some things that are a massive pain in Opposing Force, such climbing ropes, the rest of the game makes up for this. Even though the game is only about two hours long, I think it is definitely worth the price. If you loved Half-Life, than this is a must buy.
bu oyun başka bir bakış açısından bakmamızı sağlayan bir oyundur fakat bunun biraz değişini hunt down the freemanda yaptılar ki çok ama çok kötüydü bence bu oyunu alın sıkılmassınız

One of the most brutal games I've ever played. The difficulty never feels artificial either, almost every death feels deserved, and every kill feels deserved. By the end of this game I felt like an actual god, able to take on anything, without a scrape. I had to take a break from all the adrenaline running through me. Gearbox managed to copy Valve's show don't tell story telling very well, and I got genuinely invested in the HECU side of the story. With an almost entirely new array of weapons to use, and new and exciting enemies, this is definitely worth your time.

De game heeft rare haperingen in het beeld tijdens het draaien met de muis en blijft ook tijdens de game heel vervelend heb het spel twee minuten gespeeld en toen maar verwijdert omdat het niet goed werkt.

難易度が高いのと本編の小ネタが複数存在するため初代クリア後のプレイ推奨。値段は本編の1/2ですがそれなりにボリュームはあります。
日本語化はありませんが相手が何言ってるかは大体分かる上にイベントはリアルタイムで発生するので何が起きているか分かりやすく、どこでもセーブ・ロードが可能なためあまり詰むことはないと思います。

HALF-LIFEで描かれたブラックメサ事件と研究所の消滅を、事件隠蔽のために派遣された海兵隊員側から描くHALF-LIFEの外伝。パニック映画的なテイストだった初代と比べるとベトナム映画(というかエイリアン２)的なテイストが濃く、本編に負けず劣らずの映画的演出で地獄と化した研究所を克明に描いています。
主人公の所属が海兵隊なのもありデザートイーグルにスナイパーライフル、M60機関銃など全体的に火力が高いため、プレイ中の爽快感は本編より上。ただし死にやすさは相変わらずゴードン並みなため、一回の被弾が後のプレイに響いてくるシビアな(そして緊張感のある)プレイを強いられます。この塩梅が絶妙。
本編では徹底的な悪としてしか描かれなかった海兵隊ですが、シェパードくんは殺すはずの職員に救出された恩返し+任務内容開示前に事故でブラックメサに不時着したため、職員と協力して生存を図ります。また彼同様に逃げ遅れて研究所に取り残されたさまざまな技能を持つ各種隊員の力も借りる事が出来、本編以上に仲間と行動する機会が増えています。機関銃手つよい。

本作で主に描かれるのはやってきたエイリアンとの死闘と、ブラックメサを破壊して隠蔽しようとする政府直属部隊との死闘。
本編では描かれなかった研究所破壊に使用された核弾頭も登場し、爆弾解除のためにあちこち奔走する羽目になります。

Blue shiftのバーニーと異なり、結局2にもEP3の草稿にも出演できなかった超人海兵隊員シェパードくん。
彼となり再び訪れるブラックメサは、初代同様に面白く、楽しい旅でした。色褪せない名作です。

After beating half life 1, i immediately started playing this game, and wow. I actually had way more fun being a soldier than being foreman. Amazing how the creativity changes here. They could have just kept it simple, play same weapons, same little puzzles etc. But nope, valve chooses the hard way to change the perspective of the player and even adds different perks to this game. REALLY recommend it, I enjoyed this one more than the actual full game!

A great addition to the half-life universe. Nice to venture the Black Mesa facility again from the military perspective.
The gameplay and combat remain the same but there are new additions to the weapons and enemies. Played on Hard difficulty and except for black ops even today it is still fun and challenging.

I'll just respond to the question now, Opposing force is worth your time more than Blue Shift (not to say Blue Shift is terrible)

Opposing force is an excellent addition to the Half Life series. It brings new weapons to play with, new aliens and enemies to combat, new segments of the half life universe, and more.

Corporal Shepard is an interesting character that feels different than say Barney in blue shift or gordon in HL. You have a new way of navigating Black Mesa facilities. The new weapons and enemies fit in nice and are interesting and Black Mesa feels more expanded on. 

For sure worth a shot if you enjoyed Half Life

Mostly same problems as in HL1

+ You play Black Mesa incident from a different perspective. It's pretty cool, there are moments which also happenned in HL1, you just see them from different perspective and it's pretty well done.
+ New weapons, they are awesome too.

- New enemies, most of them are pain in the ass
- Soldiers are even more annoying and pain in the ass than in HL1
- Full of difficulty spikes.
- Xen levels... Again
- Is there something after credits? I can move and jump, but can only see black screen.
- Teammates are so broken. Medics never healed me. If they follow me, they quickly stop and I have to talk to them again, time to time they deside to shoot at me for a few seconds even through I did nothing to them.
- Boss battles, like developers tried to make them decent, but instead they feel like ripped off of HL1 bosses, but are much worse.

Half life and Doom are my most played games in my Steam library and my favorite first person shooter games of all times. I remember playing Half life back in the day on my old PC. But now l can say that l enjoyed Half life's expansion pack opposing force more than the base game. This time you get to play as the bad guys the Marines who are sent to clean up the disaster that took place at Black Mesa no survives must escape that means Scientists, Aliens and Gordon Freeman. I love half life it is full of hard core action and when the fighting takes a break you need to solve puzzles to advance to the next area or to eliminate enemies. They have also added new human and alien weapons you will also go up against new alien creatures and the old aliens from Half life 1. You will fight black ops soldiers but don't worry in some parts of the game you will have your squad accompanying you it will help taking down enemies easier without worrying about getting overwhelmed by enemies . I highly recommend picking this up, you don't need the original half life to run this and it's super cheap and this can run on almost any PC so don't worry about the system requirements. I give it a 10/10.

A really fun 6-hour expansion to Half-Life.

Some of the encounters are honestly rather obtuse, and basically amount to a series of bullet sponges that you have to remember the locations of, and in my opinion the final boss is a bit slow a fight, but overall, it's a really fun 6 hours. Out of the three expansions to Half-Life that Gearbox made, this is most certainly the strongest.

Honestly, I'd say this is worth playing just for some of the utterly bonkers weapons.

Definitely recommended to anyone who enjoys the Half-Life series, even if you're more of a HL2 fan.

Man, what an experience.

I haven't [b] properly [/b] played a Half-Life in 15 years. That said, I was expecting something else. I've experienced many FPS games in these years, I've seen it all. But the Half-Life expansions have really missed my library, until this recent summer sale when I purchased the Valve Complete Pack.

[h1] The Best Half-Life there is [/h1]

For some, that may be an overstatement, but hear me out. I've now played ALL the half-life games. HL1, HL2, Blue Shift, Opposing Force, Decay (PS2) and even Uplink (the demo to HL1). But Opposing Force did something better than the others, it gave this series a true personality. 

Let me explain:

So the game is played from the perspective on Cpl. Adrian Shepard, a HECU Marine sent to investigate the Black Mesa incident once a phenomenon know as a "resonance cascade" allowed for a sudden alien invasion. The unit that Shepard is sent with is kinda late, as the game begins sometime after the chapter "Surface Tension" in Half-Life. The story connects instantly, as one of the Apache helicopter that accompanies Shepard's squad flies off to intercept Gordon Freeman, who is now outside and "on the loose" trying to fight his way to the Lambda Complex. Shortly after, your helicopter gets shot down and the fight immediately begins to erupt. Marines vs Aliens, all-out-war.

You wake up after an unknown amount of time, sometime before the beginning of "Forget about Freeman". The story becomes no longer after investigating the attack, but getting out of the facility. The situation is out of control, everyone runs for their lives, including the marines.

From here on out, from the order to "get out" and all the way until the ending, you must fight through Black Mesa with you military skills and some other help. This "help" comes in the form of your fellow marine friends, who will assist you in combat. There are a couple of classes that can help you. The Medic (who heals you), the engineer (who opens doors for you) and the heavy weapons guy (a dude with an LMG who kills everything in his path). There are also some generic soldiers like the gas mask guy and the lieutenant, who are both useless in combat, but I'll touch on that later.

The way that this expansion is the definitive Half-Life experience is due to the addition of many more things that weren't present on Half-Life. New aliens (a giant tank-like alien, a creature that shoots some sort of electrical weapon, and a smaller creature with claws that can leap to you and kill you in a couple of hits), new weapons (LMG, Sniper, Deagle, some sort of fish that instakills anything, a barnacle that can be used to attach to walls and climb unreachable aliens, and a launcher that can teleport you or other creatures to Xen), and also cool new bosses like a giant worm-like creature and the final one, which is a colossal amalgamation between all other aliens (i think). All of this is topped by the Black Ops soldiers, your sworn enemies, who are even deadlier than in the original game. There are multiple types of Black Ops, from the regular ninjas to the Black Ops soldiers, who are heavily armored, take longer to kill and can easily flank you and kill you if you're not strategic enough.

The puzzle mechanics of Half-Life have been reduced a bit, there's way less platforming and instead the expansion focuses more on combat rather than just jumping through levels, but the supplement of new enemies and weapons provides for a much more fun experience. All of the action sequences are really well done, you always feel on the edge, running and dodging bullets from the Black Ops, and outsmarting the aliens at every step. You will feel accomplished, overwhelmed, a bit tired, but that's what Black Mesa does to you, I guess.

Many themes are picked up in Opposing Force, and your main objective of investigating the attack (you never got the order to silence the witnesses, so killing scientists is not one of your priorities, neither is Freeman, since the order was to "forget about freeman") suddenly become about escaping the facility, later about disarming the nuke that the Black Ops set up in order to end the facilty once and for all, and at the end, you're supposed to finish off the "nastiest thing yet", the final boss in order to escape Black Mesa and aid in saving the world (although Mr.Freeman did that already, I guess).

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]

So did Opposing Force live up to my expectations? Yes, it did. I came back to this franchise years later, and I finished the first game's trilogy with a bang. O.F. was that bang, exactly what the series needed, and the amount of content is incredible. 

Some cons? Sure, the AI of your companions is a bit crap (they will get stuck in doors and not attack enemies) and also some pacing issues at the beginning but overall the game is solid.

[h1] 9.5/10 [/h1]
